is a village of approximately 1500 inhabitants in
, in the wooded valley of the river Derwent, 17 miles north of

By rail from Derby on the Derwent Valley Line, operated by East Midlands Trains; railway station is a short distance outside the village, a level walk of approx 3/4-mile (allow at least 15 minutes).
By car: on the main A6 Derby to

trunk road. Nearest motorway is M1: J26 if travelling from the south or J28 if travelling from the north.
By bus/coach: National Express service 440 daily from/to Manchester/

. TransPeak long-distance bus line from Derby/Nottingham to Manchester and return stops in the village; daytime services approx every hour. TransPeak is also good for accessing the Peak District heartland, stopping at Bakewell and Buxton and various scenic locations.
